Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Hey. I feel so lucky we're in the same city for Valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's like magic. Or, it's like me getting on my hands and knees and begging my partners to switch a Tuesday for a Thursday.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [makes magic trick hand gesture] Alakazam!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: By the way, they do need an extra day next week.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And, poof! He disappears. [Jim snaps, playing along]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [to Pete] Hey! Wanna play hookey today?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, maybe. What do you have in mind?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We can do anything you want.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I really wanna have fun today because tomorrow is going to be a nightmare. Andy's coming back from his stupid, dumb boat trip. He's been rude. He's been selfish. I think he's a big jerk. And I'm breaking up with him. Bam, Andy! How do you like me now?... I hope as a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Erin says she's gonna break up with Andy, but I'm not sure. He's coming back tomorrow and surprise, today, she wants to do whatever I'd like. You know, when I was a kid, we had a dog who go real sick and we had to 'send him to a farm'. And on his last day, we did everything he loved.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [has an idea and reveals a frisbee from under her desk] Wanna play catch in the parking lot?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [slightly surprised] Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I'll get my coat.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Perfect. [Pete walks away eying the camera knowingly]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [knocks on Andy's door, then pretends to answer as Andy] Come in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking to Andy's empty chair] Andy, hi. I just made another huge sale for the company that you manage. I need you to authorize that expense report and sign off on that contract.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pretending to be Andy] I would be happy to. It would be my pleasure, Mr. Schrute. Rick-a-dick-doo, rick-a-dick-dick-dick, rick-a-dick-doo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I really like Andy these days. He's pretend and he does exactly as I tell him to. All that will change when real Andy comes back tomorrow. [thinks for a moment] Unless he comes back as pretend Dwight. In which case, we're in for an epic, confusing showdown.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy left a carton of milk in the fridge. So, I've been sneaking a little bit every day for the last three months. It's been yummy. But now, Andy's coming back. So, I guess it's goodbye chunky, lemon milk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to entire office]OK, I'll say it. I wish Andy had stayed on his trip.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I say we all have one last fun boss-less day.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's get some booze and some cocaine and just blow it out. No consequences.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Or the mini mall. They have all these Valentine Day deals. You can get 20% off if you come in with your husband or your [to Nellie] boyfriend. But, I mean, if you don't have one of those you can probably just bring whoever it is you use to kill your loneliness.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Phil, I'll pretend to be your husband. I'm already sick of you, so it'll seem realistic.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They have a nail salon there where I get my feet detailed. [to Meredith] They use a watch repair kit.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Angela] Ew! I'll be your foot buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Everyone, it is our last day here with no manager. I say we go to the mini mall. Clark, you will be my fake boyfriend so I can get the discount.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: It's what I do. [everyone begins to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Darryl, everyone seems to be pairing off. Do you want to pretend to be a couple so we get the...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No... yes, yes. Why wouldn't I... wanna pretend to be gay? Got no problem with that.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All right, it'll be easy. Don't be nervous, just follow my...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [interrupting] Stop talking 'bout it. I said I'm fine with it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [eating] These are gross.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They are terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, don't fill up on chocolates. I made us a lunch reservation at State Street Grill.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my god. That's so romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's with Brian and Alyssa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my god. That's less romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. But we should go. We need to thank him for, you know, saving my life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. No, totally. That's good. So, should we just get a bottle of wine later and celebrate?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That sounds nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm very excited to see Brian. Brian's a great guy. And Pam and I have gotten really close to he and his wife, Alyssa over the years. And he got fired for protecting my wife from a jerk in the warehouse. I'm sorry, but you know him. He's a good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Nail stylist 1
Quote.Text: Oh, tiny, poor lady is back. Oh, get the baby clipper. [other nails stylists gush over Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Nail stylist 2
Quote.Text: [to Clark] You take off your glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: 'Kay. [removes glasses]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [nail stylist 2 giggles] What?

Quote.Speaker: Nail stylist 2
Quote.Text: Your boyfriend. He look like a pretty girl.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: My boyfriend does look like a pretty girl, doesn't he? Yes, a very little pretty girl. And you know what, now that you are developing, we should go and get you a training bra. [both laugh at Clark]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Oh, you guys think this is funny? You know what? No more discount. [to nail manager] Excuse me. [gesturing he and Nellie] Full price. We're not together.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: She's living a lie.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Turns out, I can't even be in a pretend relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [to nail manager] Hi. We'd like a couples discount on a pair of foot massages.

Quote.Speaker: Nail manager
Quote.Text: No. No discount for two men. Two men are not a couple.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We are together. Romantically.

Quote.Speaker: Nail manager
Quote.Text: Two men? [other nail stylist speaks Korean to manager, both laugh] [gestures index fingers bumping together] Doesn't work. No discount.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, it works. Him and me, all right, we are crazy in love. More love than your small mind can comprehend. And we have two disposable incomes. And no kids. And we're taking our business elsewhere. [Oscar and Darryl exit holding hands]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [enters restaurant with Pam] Hey, Brian.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry we're late.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, no problem. I finished all the bread.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ha,ha,ha, yeah OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's on a no carb thing. Supposedly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: It's, uh, great to see you guys. Thanks for coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? Thank you, man. I mean, I've wanted the opportunity to say thanks for... everything. And I'm really sorry about the job. That just seems crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: It's fine. What are you gonna do, you know? But, if you guys know of any work, I'm fully available.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, my dad can't hear a thing. You could boom his whole life for him.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: That's... OK, great. Does he pay well?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where's Alyssa?

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. Um, you know, Alyssa's, she's not gonna make it today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Actually, we're not gonna make it. Um... we're splitting up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Andy's empty chair] I have yet another sales order for you to sign.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [acting as Andy] Why thank you Mr. Schrute. I don't know how you do it. You're a god. Rick-a-dick-dick-doo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in his office doorway, bearded and unkept] Hi Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're back. [surveys Andy] And you're disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [as everyone returns to the office] Ah, geez. My nails aren't dry yet. I don't think I can work for at least a couple hours.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, well, well, look who it is.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I guess I can cancel my order from Zappos.com because, oh, the loafers have arrived.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Sweetheart! [approaches Erin] I have missed you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [obviously avoiding Andy's embrace] Yes. [gives Andy high fives] Welcome back, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [attempting to hug Erin as she resists] I have been dreaming of this moment.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Me too. So much. I'm so happy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I am really, really bad at break ups. Technically, I'm still dating my first grade boyfriend. I mean, we just had our 20th anniversary. And, I forgot to get him something.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What happened? We thought you were coming back tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, Valentine's surprise for Erin. Hello? Super romantic. And I got you something. [removes wooden instruments from bag] Oh, it's a couple of pieces of bamboo. Big deal, right? No. These are musical instruments. It's so we can play island music together. Cause I have this. [removes güiro and begins playing and singing] Clop the cloppers. Yeah, clop 'em. It's called Bembe. [sings while Kevin echoes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Burning Man, if it's not selling out too much, you might want to throw on a tie. David Wallace is gonna be here in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Obviously, that's why I'm here. I mean, I came back early to surprise Erin. Happy Valentine's Day, sweetheart. [tries to embrace Erin but she begins playing cloppers] But, I'm just saying, I'm also excited about the Wallace meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Why? Isn't he just coming in to rip you a new one for being gone three months?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Please. Come on, Clark. Wallace knows that he's been gone for the last three months. [Andy stalls] Right? Wallace does know that you've been gone for the last three months?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I have no idea. I don't know what he knows or doesn't know. But we've been in touch the whole time. I mean, it's not hard to get high-speed internet in Turks de Caicos, people. It's in every Bembe cafe.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He only emailed me four times.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Question. Where's Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He and Pam are having their Valentine's Day lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For two hours? Really?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So, you're concerned about peoples' long absence from their place of work?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If the shoe fits. [plays güiro and sings, Kevin echoes]

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: We were telling two different versions of the same story. And then, everything just went numb.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I mean, that's OK. It doesn't mean that it's over. Right? I mean, couples fight.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Yeah. That's the thing. When we were fighting, it weirdly felt like the relationship was still alive. And, it wasn't until we stopped fighting that, we realized that it was over. You know, it's over. [overcome by emotion] I'm sorry, this is... oh my god, OK. [to Pam] We have to stop seeing each other like this. We have to find a different way to communicate other than breaking down in front of each other.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [obviously flustered] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: At least my crying won't get you fired.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Crying?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I noticed that you landed the Scranton White Pages account. That is tremendous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And you sold it to Jan too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean... I'm impressed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughing together] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, there's one problem. Couldn't help but notice that you offered a price point that was not approved by the head office. So... gotta run that stuff by me, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You were on a boat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On a boat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In the ocean.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. The issue is that you need to run this stuff by me. Coolio? Are we coolio? [Dwight resists] Just say the word 'coolio'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna say it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Say it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not a word.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Coolio.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! [Andy makes a call] What do you think you're doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just gonna call the Scranton White Pages and clear this right up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't you dare! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Jan. Nard dog here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was just looking over the paperwork. I found a little hiccup.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. It appears my employee offered you a price that he was not authorized to.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispers] Coolio.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Seriously? You're calling me a few weeks after finalizing our contract to gouge me now for more money? Is that what you're doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Coolio. Coolio.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no Jan I think you misunderstood.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Coolio.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It, it's, it's actually just an issue...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know what? You know what, uh, Nard dog? There is an option in the contract that allows me to back out within 30 days of signing. So, I would like to exercise that option.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Jan! Please do not listen to this boob! Remember Clark. He gave you everything. Everything.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jan, I don't know what he's talking about but...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Tell Angela to send me a final invoice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, ah, ah...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please Ja, Ja... [Jan hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aw! That was not how I had hoped that would go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [approaching Accounting] Hey, everybody, great job. [to Angela] Listen, we're a smidge behind on my paychecks.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, well, as you know, we get paid on Fridays. And you haven't been here for 12 Fridays. [hands Andy a folder]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right. Thank you very much. [examines checks] Looking good. [after noticing something on Angela's desk] Who's that little fella?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's a bonus check. For you. From Wallace. Because the branch exceeded it's targets over the past quarter.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, that's wonderful!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: A quarter's three months. That's how long you've been gone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh-huh... [after awkward pause] Uh-huh. [Angela hands him the bonus check] Thank you. Great. Well, we're all up to speed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two seconds of the turd dog and he loses the biggest sale this branch has ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [emotional] Do you have any idea what I had to do to get that sale from Jan? I mean, I went all out. All out. I mean like everything was out the whole week.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He just waltzes back in here like he owns the chunky, lemon milk. Who needs him, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God! I just don't know what we'd do. I mean, short of telling David Wallace that he was gone for three months.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd like to rat out Andy. Unfortunately, I have a bit of a boy-who-cried-wolf dynamic with David Wallace. Except, instead of a boy, I'm a man. And instead of a wolf, I cried genetically-engineered monster wolf.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm not going to rat on him. No, Andy gave me a second chance. So, the least I could do is let somebody else rat on him. Meredith, why don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Meredith Palmer ain't never been called no nark. Floozy? Yes. Alkie? Check. Einstein sarcastically? You bet. But never no nark. Vomit mop? Sure. Floor meat? That's me. Flesh hoover?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Meredith, that's plenty. All right? That's more than plenty. Why does no one stop her?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Guys. I know that a lot of people are mad at Andy and, believe me, I am too. But, he has been through a lot and we all used to love him, right? So, if he's gonna get in trouble, just let it be his fault not ours. I don't want that on my hands.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine! The state he's in, Wallace will take one look at him and probably fire him anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [appears approaching group, shaved and in a suit] What's going on in here, dirty players? Let's get back to busting some paper rhymes. Come on. [singing] Who's that girl? Who's that girl? It's Andy! [resumes talking] All right. Back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, I can tell you're mad at me. Do you wanna just, um, I don't know, tell me why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. I thought that was a little weird. You told me Brian got fired for the whole warehouse thing. And you intentionally left out a kind of major, intimate detail. I don't know, Pam, I guess I just feel like a chump. Who knows less about his marriage than the sound guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I didn't tell you about the crying because I didn't want you to know how upset I was. Because it would've stressed you out and you're always saying how much you don't want more stress.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well. Yeah, OK. Well, then thank you. Thanks to both of you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's not Brian's fault.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're right. And, and I'm not mad at Brian. And to be honest, I probably don't have any reason to be mad at all because I wasn't there. So, let's just forget about it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I need you guys to tell me all the highlights from the last three months in case David asks. Just a few things I could sprinkle into conversation. Any big sales or office gossip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, we had the Scranton White Pages.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not helpful. Let's stay positive, people. OK?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [enters] Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! David! How are ya? Ah, we were just having our weekly round table where we motivate each other. Not gonna lie, I get as much out of it as they do.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Sounds great. Don't let me interrupt. What ever you guys have been doing this last quarter, I couldn't be happier with the numbers.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Well, finish up. I'm gonna meet with Val about that warehouse guy you had to let go and you and I will talk in 15 minutes?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great!

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [leaving] Great job, everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [whispering] We had to let a warehouse guy go?!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You know Pam's mural? Well, Frank...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [interrupting] ... lit the whole thing on fire. It was crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There was a fire in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The whole thing is in ashes. Fire department was here. It was in all the papers.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is what I'm talking about! This would be good to know. All right, what else?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We started selling balloons.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah. And, uh, Kathy Ireland signed on as the official spokes-babe of Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah. In the European billboards, she's gonna be topless.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow. Go Kathy. She's like 50.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: They're tasteful.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good, good. What else?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who knew the balloon game would be so lucrative? And thank god, right? We needed the income after the fire.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: What fire?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The warehouse fire. Weren't you just down there? It's like burnt to ashes.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: It looked fine to me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [catches on to the ruse] I am speaking metaphorically, of course. You know I have lots of irons in quote-unquote fire. Well, that's one of them. You know, making sure that the warehouse logistics is a well-oiled, properly-stoked fire.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think you'll agree I explained that pretty well.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [preparing to leave] Thanks, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: All right. Everyone! [waves to office and exits]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [enters Andy's office to find him playing güiro] Fish sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really playing the scales, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, it just sort of sounds like noise to me now. You think I need a new fish?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't love you anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I still like you, but you were gone a really long time. And, you didn't really email me all that much. You retweeted me, a lot to be fair. But I don't love you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, I get it. You're unhappy. I've been gone a long time and we lost a little bit of juju. But, you and me, we have a future. There is a lot of love here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I just said there isn't love.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: On your side. But there's tons on my side. It's gushing. We're just out of sync right now. But that's just timing, it's timing. I mean, my parents lasted 38, 40 years. They were never happy at the same time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, what do we have left? 35, maybe 40 years? If we're lucky. I mean, I have spent a lot of time in the sun.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You got really sunburned.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna be a prune in like, 3 years.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know you may not be feeling love for me right now but, if you fake it, I won't be able to tell the difference. So, I'll feel good. And then, eventually, maybe, you'll actually start to love me again.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You really think we can get that back?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes. [hugs Erin] Come on. Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Maybe we should cancel that bottle of wine tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I just feel like I got a bunch of stuff to do in Philly and I'm sure you have stuff to do. So we can just... I don't know, drop me at the bus station?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just feel like we're gonna fight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [obviously hurt] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So... how 'bout let's not?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. [they begin to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, um. [pulls item from bag and hands to Pam] Happy Valentine's Day. Sorry, I didn't have time to wrap it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees it's a drawing of hers, framed] Wow. I didn't know you kept this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think you should go to Philly tonight. I think that you should stay and I think we should fight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You really wanna fight on Valentine's Day?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. All right, put your dukes up, Beesly.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey, you OK?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I couldn't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, you don't have to apologize. I just... I just want you to be happy. OK? [Erin smiles and kisses Pete]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [bursts into Andy's office] We're breaking up. And just so you know, I was worried that you were dead. You were gone for three months.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Andy. It's David. Still here. What was that about three months?
